# Draft:Golden Shot award

----
The Golden Shot, sponsored by the Daily Record, was an award presented to the first player to score a total of 30 goals in a domestic league and cup football season. Only goals scored in the SFL, SPL, Scottish Cup, and Scottish League Cup competitions were counted.
The first player to reach the milestone each season also won a case of champagne and a cheque for £1,000, with a cheque for £500 going to second player to score 30 goals the player who finishes nearest the 30 goals mark.
A Silver Shot award was introduced for season 1992–93 because the main award had been won in record time.
